text: Rosemary Hollis (1952 â€“ 8 June 2020) was a British political scientist. She was a professor of Middle East Policy Studies at City University London until her retirement in 2018. Hollis was known for her studies and scholarship on the relations between the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States with the Middle East. She was the Research Director at Chatham House (the Royal Institute of International Affairs). She was born in Dudley, West Midlands. Hollis died on 8 June 2020. ==References== Category:1952 births Category:2020 deaths Category:British political scientists Category:British political writers Category:British academics Category:People from West Midlands (county)
title: Rosemary Hollis
